alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Evangeline; Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:57PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lafayette, southeastern Evangeline, Acadia, northwestern St. Martin and St. Landry Parishes through 945 PM CDT... At 856 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Melville to Lawtell to 6 miles east of Pine Island. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Opelousas, Crowley, Eunice, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, Church Point, Iota, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Melville, Palmetto, Bayou Current, Sunset, Port Barre, Duson and Washington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 81 and 100, and between mile markers 108 and 114. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and southwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Evangeline; Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
